alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, in central Virginia, City of Colonial Heights. In south central Virginia, City of Petersburg and Dinwiddie. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Colonial Heights, Virginia State University, Fort Lee, Sutherland, Ettrick, Petersburg Airport, Five Forks, Church Road, Burgess, Addison, Center Star, Walkers, Ford, Richard Bland College and Petersburg National Battlefield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
